abstract: MasterCard saw its second-quarter profit nearly double, but shares slid after the company fell short of the most optimistic analyst estimates.
snippet: MasterCard saw its second-quarter profit nearly double, but shares slid after the company fell short of the most optimistic analyst estimates.
lead_paragraph: Shares of MasterCard Inc., the second-biggest credit card company after Visa, dropped the most since last year’s initial public offering after the company reported earnings that fell short of the most optimistic analyst estimates.
